thread.title: O'Hare opens latest new runway in decade-long modernization
thread.title_full: O'Hare opens latest new runway in decade-long modernization - The Denver Post

author: The Associated Press
title: O'Hare opens latest new runway in decade-long modernization
text:
CHICAGO (AP) â€” Chicago's O'Hare International Airport is set to open a new runway and air traffic control tower Thursday, completing another piece of the $9 billion overhaul of its outdated airfield.
For more than a decade, Chicago has been untangling O'Hare's six crisscrossing runways and rearranging them in a safer, more efficient side-by-side layout that's supposed to unclog one of the country's worst aviation bottlenecks.
Yet delays still ensnare many passengers traveling through the hub. O'Hare is generally last in the rankings for on-time performance.
With the $516 million runway on the airport's southern edge, O'Hare now has five of its six planned parallel runways.
DePaul University aviation expert Joseph Schwieterman says the progress puts to rest fears that O'Hare would be unable to handle future growth in the number of flights.
